pr_title: Add ZSTD support for writing ORC and DWRF tables

timeline.message: Add ZSTD support for Hive Compression codec
Add ZSTD support for Hive Compression codec
Add ZSTD support for Hive Compression codec
Add ZSTD support for Hive Compression codec

Add ZSTD support for write

Adding ZSTD support for writing table. It is only supported with
ORC and DWRF.
It is supported via session property prism.compression_codec.

timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: nit: f -> false might be shorter and easier to read
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText:
I agree allStorageFormatsSupported().negate() might be a bit difficult to follow, but I guess @jainxrohit 's initial motivation not to  inline the lambda  is it might help a could bit with the intention (basically, the method name is used as comment).
An alternative way would be have a separate method noneStorageFormatsSupported . But it might make too many "trivial" methods.  No strong opinion here :)
Also: Can you use static final variable to store the lambda?
replies.author: wenleix

replies.bodyText: It seems like the general opinion seems to be on the side of using lamdas directly. I would change it.
replies.author: jainxrohit

timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.bodyText: perhaps, f -> f == ORC || f == DWRF
timeline.author: mbasmanova

@jainxrohit We tend to add a message like this:
requireNonNull(supportedStorageFormats, "supportedStorageFormats is null")

timeline.bodyText:
nit: parquetCompressionCodec -> codec in the lambda
compression.getParquetCompressionCodec().ifPresent(codec -> config.set(ParquetOutputFormat.COMPRESSION, codec.name()));
timeline.author: mbasmanova

timeline.message:
Add ZSTD support for write

Add ZSTD support for writing ORC and DWRF tables.
To enable ZSTD compression, use session property hive.compression_codec='ZSTD'.
